org.eclipse.january.dataset

Interface IDynamicShape

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDatasetConnector, IDynamicDataset, ILazyWriteableDataset
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LazyDynamicDataset, LazyWriteableDataset

    public interface IDynamicShape
    This interface is intended for data sources that change shape dynamically. Examples: 1. An image stream from a camera encoded which entire image, changes periodically. 2. An HDF5 dataset which entire shape changes as data is added.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int UNLIMITED
      Denotes an unlimited dimension in maximum shape

    • Method Detail

      • getDataset

        ILazyDataset getDataset()
        Returns:
        dataset associated with shape

      • resize

        boolean resize(int... newShape)
        Change shape
        Parameters:
        newShape -
        Returns:
        true if shape has changed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if new shape exceeds maximum shape or is of different rank
        UnsupportedOperationException - if used on a view

      • getMaxShape

        int[] getMaxShape()
        Returns:
        maximum shape (can be null)

      • setMaxShape

        void setMaxShape(int... maxShape)
        Set maximum shape
        Parameters:
        maxShape - maximum shape

      • startUpdateChecker

        void startUpdateChecker(int milliseconds,
                        IDatasetChangeChecker checker)
        Starts a periodic checker to see if dataset has changed in some manner. If any potential changes are detected after the period has finished then registered listeners are alerted. A period of 0 or less will stop any existing checker.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - period between checks in milliseconds
        checker - can be null for default implementation of alerting listeners unconditionally

      • refreshShape

        boolean refreshShape()
        Force the shape to be re-read from file, if possible
        Returns:
        true if shape has changed

      • addDataListener

        void addDataListener(IDataListener l)
        Add a listener which will be fired when aspects of the data change for instance shape or content.
        Parameters:
        l -

      • removeDataListener

        void removeDataListener(IDataListener l)
        Remove a listener which will be fired when aspects of the data change for instance shape or content.
        Parameters:
        l -

      • fireDataListeners

        Alert any registered listeners
